bibl.title: Dispatch from Robert S. Newton to John L. Cadwalader
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.opener:
No. 122
United States Commercial Agency
at St Paul de Loanda
div1.p: To the Department of State Mr. Robert Scott Newton
Subject, Coasting Trade between the Ports of Angola

Abstract of Contents Enclosing translation of circular from the Governor General intimating that no interference will take place on the part of the Government with respect to the Coasting Trade, by Foreign vessels.

div1.opener:
No. 122
United States Commercial Agency
St. Paul de Loanda 19th February 1877
div1.p:
Sir
I have the honor to enclose the translation of a circular dated 10th February 1877 received from His Excellency the Governor General of this Province intimating that no interference will take place on the part of the Government in reference to the Coasting Trade between the Ports of the Province of Angola referred to in my despatch No 116.

closer.salute:
I have the honor
to be
Your most obedt Servant
closer.signed:
Robt S. Newton
Vice Commercial Agent

div1.p:
Illustrious Sir,
His Excellency the Governor General, has instructed me to advise you that His Majesty's Government in order to encourage commerce, permits small vessels, with foreign flags, to trade on the Coast of this Province as previous to the publication of the provincial order No. 404 of the 21st September of the past year

closer.dateline: Office of the Secretary General in Loanda 10th February 1877
